key_channel_insights.line_content: The OTA channel consistently reflects higher prices, showing a 96.55% occurrence rate against the airline's website.
The MSE channel presents a competitive landscape with 45.35% of offers lower than the airline's official pricing.
The GDS channel exhibits significant pricing discrepancies, regularly listing higher than the airline's offerings in over 98% of cases.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: The OTA channel consistently lists prices higher than the airline’s website across all analyzed dimensions, with last week showing an average discrepancy of 0.11%.
Booking frequency remained stable across dimensions, suggesting no significant shifts in consumer interest in the OTA compared to last week.
While the overall price differences were minimal, slight changes occurred with a 0.04% increase in price differences observed from the previous week.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In the latest week, there were no instances where the OTA prices were lower than the airline's website.
The OTA prices were noted to be higher 96.55% of the time last week, reinforcing the trend of elevated prices in this distribution channel.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Pricing across regions shows OTA prices consistently above site listings, with no significant variations between different travel areas.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Origins from LV and Non-LV display a similar trend, with OTA prices predominantly higher, suggesting uniformity in pricing strategy across markets.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_title: Close In vs Far Out Pricing
ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings reflect higher prices (approximately 94.92%) compared to far-out bookings, which are uniformly higher, but showing no variability.

mse_highlights.line_content: The MSE channel frequently offers lower prices, with 45.35% of cases being lower than the airline’s website offerings after the latest week.
In the latest week, almost 25.58% of MSE prices matched those on the airline's website, indicating stability in pricing.
There has been a significant increase in lower pricing by 15.12% compared to the previous month, suggesting improved competitiveness in MSE.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The proportion of MSE offers below the airline's website is 45.35%, showing a robust presence in lower pricing.
Just 29.07% of MSE prices were higher than the airline's web offerings, reflecting competitive pricing in the market.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Overall, 29.07% of the MSE records for all regions showed higher prices compared to the airline's own site, highlighting areas for potential pricing strategy adjustment.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Latvian point-of-origin tickets, 53.49% were priced lower on MSE, showcasing effective pricing alignment with market demand.
In Non-Latvian routes, 37.21% of prices were higher, suggesting competitive challenges in this segment.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, 56.90% of MSE prices were lower compared to the airline's website, indicating a strategic advantage for last-minute travelers.
Conversely, for far-out bookings, the MSE channel showed higher prices in 53.57% of cases, which may deter early planners.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel predominantly lists higher prices compared to the airline's website, with over 98% of instances reflecting this trend.
The average price difference of 0.11% in the last week remains stable when compared to previous weeks, indicating consistent pricing strategies.
In close-in bookings, the GDS channel shows higher prices in 98.3% of cases, creating potential market access challenges for price-sensitive travelers.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The GDS channel consistently shows higher prices compared to the website, with a price difference of 0.10% last week.
Zero offers were available on the GDS channel for certain itineraries, indicating a 100% gap in availability for some routes.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: All short-haul routes showed prices higher on the GDS channel, reinforcing a systematic discrepancy in pricing.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For non-LV origin routes, the GDS channel similarly lists higher prices 97.7% of the time, maintaining the trend observed across all origins.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: In the close-in booking window, higher prices were noted in 98.3% of scenarios, emphasizing a need for competition with online direct offers.
Far out bookings show no availability on the GDS channel, resulting in missed opportunities for price optimization.
